channel.title: [PI] Coming online on a second server!?
channel.description:
Hi everyone,
I've been wanting to host my original server on my VPS and make a second server to just play on (without the other players) so I can update there without bothering anyone and eventually when I'm done I can just switch my source in my original server and I could update everything in one time.
However I've made a new map for my "TestServer" and I have my source and client in there. I've change my no-ip host in my client.java and gui.java. And since I've already been hosting my other server on my own PC I'd say my portforwarding etc etc is already good. However when I try logging in it still redirects me to my original server (with all the players).
Any suggestions on how I could change this? (PLEASE NOTE THAT THE ORIGINAL SERVER MAY NOT COME OFFLINE)

item.title: [PI] Coming online on a second server!?
item.dc:creator: @UniqueTrys UniqueTrys
item.description:
@UniqueTrys wrote:

Haha :p. Thanks guys the 127.0.0.1 worked out, very thankful

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Coming online on a second server!?

item.title: [PI] Coming online on a second server!?
item.dc:creator: @cLass1 .cLass
item.description:
@cLass1 wrote:

Do what I do, make a copy of it, make the copy host on port 43595 or 5556 for example, just a different port from your original server, then make a copy of your client and make it connect to that port. Then when you are done updating, Merge the copy with the real server and change the port to the original one and it all works out fine

I have 1 hand on my dick atm so i am typing this with one hand, that’s why it is kinda bad7wierdly written

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Coming online on a second server!?

item.title: [PI] Coming online on a second server!?

item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

If you have it on a no-ip people can connect, local they can’t.

item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

Pro4Show:

wrong section

Naw.

Anyways, you should be hosting the local server on ‘127.0.0.1’.
